basics.name: Anand Sharma
basics.summary: An enginnering student , passionate about building and designing machine learning systems that solve real-world problems

work.name: Department of Chemistry, IIT Hyderabad
highlights: Led a computational study focusing on Covalent Organic Frameworks (COFs) for their potential application in photocatalytic hydrogen evolution, aiming to explore sustainable energy solutions.
Developed expertise in quantum chemistry and computational chemistry, gaining proficiency in simulating the electronic and structural properties of materials using VASP and Quantum Espresso.
Played a key role in compiling and parallelizing Density Functional Theory (DFT) codes into High-Performance Computing (HPC) systems.
Authored several Python, and bash post-processing scripts for the visualization and analysis of simulation results.
Employed Chemcraft and VESTA for modeling COF structures, contributing to a deeper understanding of COFs' properties and their potential for sustainable energy applications.

projects.name: Handwritten Equation Solver
projects.summary: Developed a computer vision-based system to solve handwritten mathematical equations by training a CNN on a dataset of mathematical symbols and creating a custom Python class for equation solving.
highlights: Achieved high accuracy in symbol classification using CNNs.
Integrated OpenCV for image preprocessing and symbol segmentation.
Deployed the model on a web application for real-time equation solving.

projects.name: Crystine (CRYSTal INsight Engine)
projects.summary: Developed a Python library for data analysis, primarily used in computational chemistry research for analyzing and visualizing crystal structures.
highlights: Automated the conversion of raw computational data into meaningful plots and insights.
Published the library on PyPI, gaining adoption in multiple research labs.

projects.name: Computational Study on the Effect of Acetylene Linkage on COF for Photocatalytic Hydrogen Evolution
projects.summary: Conducted a comprehensive computational study to investigate the impact of acetylene linkages on the electronic properties of Covalent Organic Frameworks (COFs) for hydrogen evolution reaction (HER)
highlights: Employed Density Functional Theory (DFT) with PBE and PBE0 functionals using VASP software for geometry optimization and electronic structure calculations.
Developed a custom Python library, Crystine, for efficient data analysis and visualization, which is now publicly available on PyPI.
